title: DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone - TechCrunch
summary:
DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone

Date: Not provided
Source: TechCrunch

DJI has introduced the Flip, a foldable drone priced at $439, aimed at photographers and videographers. It offers high-quality 4K video recording, 48-megapixel stills, and improved battery life.

  • The Flip weighs 249 grams and is designed for portability.
  • It features a 4K 60fps video capability and a 48MP camera with 4x zoom.
  • The drone boasts 31 minutes of battery life, surpassing the Neo's 18 minutes.
  • It includes automatic collision avoidance and improved charging features.
  • The Flip will start shipping in the U.S. soon.
“The Flip combines the simplicity of the DJI Neo with the stunning photo capabilities of the DJI Mini.”

In conclusion, the DJI Flip represents a step forward for consumer drones, merging compact design with powerful features, aimed primarily at outdoor photographers.
newTitle: DJI Flip: A Compact and Powerful $439 Foldable Drone

title: Tata Electronics captures 26% share of India's iPhone production - Business Standard
summary:
Tata Electronics Captures 26% Share of India's iPhone Production

Publication Date: January 14 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Tata Electronics has secured a significant share in the iPhone production market in India, achieving a 26% share and significantly increasing its workforce.

  • Tata Electronics experienced a 63% increase in direct employment, expanding its workforce from 19,000 to 31,000.
  • The company acquired Wistron's iPhone facility in Narsapura, Karnataka, for $125 million in October 2023.
  • Annual production at the plant soared to over Rs 40,000 crore in 2024, a 180% increase from Rs 14,300 crore in the previous year.
“During the year, Tata Electronics recorded a 63 per cent increase in direct employment at its iPhone assembly operations.”

This significant growth positions Tata Electronics firmly in the iPhone production sector in India, indicating strong progress and expansion for the company.
newTitle: Tata Electronics Captures 26% Share of India's iPhone Production

summary:

Xiaomi is reportedly working on the Mix Flip 2 foldable phone, which is expected to feature significant upgrades over its predecessor, including a new camera system and the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.

  • The Mix Flip 2 will be powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, enhancing performance and efficiency.
  • The device is expected to feature a 6.85-inch LTPO OLED inner screen with 1.5K resolution.
  • It will likely have an IPX8 rating for water resistance.
  • The camera system is set to include a 50MP primary camera and a new 50MP ultra-wide angle lens.
  • Additional features may include a side-mounted fingerprint sensor and NFC support.
As exciting as these leaks may seem, it is important to approach this information with caution. The final specifications may differ once Xiaomi officially unveils the Mix Flip 2.

In conclusion, the Mix Flip 2 is anticipated to bring noteworthy advancements, but definitive details will only come with its official launch.

Samsung S95F OLED TV: everything we know about Samsung's elite new OLED - TechRadar
summary:
Samsung S95F OLED TV: Everything We Know About Samsung's Elite New OLED

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: TechRadar

The Samsung S95F OLED TV has been officially revealed at CES 2025 as part of Samsung's 2025 OLED TV lineup, serving as the flagship model and successor to the Samsung S95D.

  • The S95D set high expectations with its OLED Glare Free technology.
  • The S95F introduces improvements, including OLED Glare Free 2.0, which nearly eliminates reflections.
  • Expected to release in March or April 2025, with pricing likely higher than its predecessor.
  • Available in sizes 55, 65, 77, and a new 83-inch model.
  • Features a new NQ4 AI Gen 3 processor with a significant increase in neural networks and brightness capabilities.
  • Supports 165Hz refresh rate and various gaming features but lacks Dolby Vision.
The S95D was our top TV of 2024, so we have pretty high expectations of the S95F.

Conclusion: The S95F OLED TV is set to elevate the standard in OLED technology, aiming to surpass the high bar set by its predecessor while incorporating cutting-edge features for gamers and movie enthusiasts alike.
newTitle: Samsung S95F OLED TV: Everything We Know About Samsung's Elite New OLED

title: iPhone 14 available for Rs 18,799 in Republic Day Sale for eligible users - India TV News
summary:

Apple's iPhone 14, originally launched in 2022, sees significant price drops as Flipkart celebrates Republic Day with major discounts for eligible buyers.

  • The initial price of the iPhone 14 was Rs 59,900.
  • With a 14% discount, the new price is Rs 50,999.
  • Additional Rs 1,000 instant discount available with HDFC bank cards.
  • Options for EMI starting at Rs 1,793.
  • Strong exchange offers allowing discounts up to Rs 30,200 for trading in old smartphones.
  • Features include the A15 Bionic chipset, dual-camera setup, and a robust aluminum and glass design.
"Even if you receive only half of the exchange value, you could still acquire the iPhone 14 at a very attractive price."

This sale presents a prime opportunity for prospective iPhone buyers, offering both immediate savings and promotional benefits for trade-ins.

title: Motorola just dropped a pair of good-looking affordable phones under $300 - Android Central
summary:
Motorola Launches Affordable Moto G Power 2025 and Moto G 2025 Smartphones

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Android Central

Motorola introduces its first budget devices of 2025, featuring enhanced durability and impressive specifications at attractive prices.

  • The Moto G Power 2025 features wireless charging and an IP68/IP69 rating for water and dust resistance.
  • The Moto G 2025 offers 30W charging, Gorilla Glass 3 protection, and IP52 resistance.
  • Both models are powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset and come with Android 15 pre-installed.
  • Pricing starts at $299 for the Moto G Power 2025 and $199 for the Moto G 2025, available soon.
“Motorola is stepping up its protection for the Moto G Power 2025... This means the phone can withstand being submerged and should be able to hold out when facing high-pressure water jets.”

Both phones are designed for budget-conscious consumers looking for robust features and stylish designs.
newTitle: Motorola Launches Affordable Moto G Power 2025 and Moto G 2025 Smartphones

title: Motorola’s new phone is tougher than most flagships for a fraction of the price - The Verge
summary:
Motorola’s new phone is tougher than most flagships for a fraction of the price

Published on: January 30, 2025 Source: The Verge

Motorola has announced the first 2025 updates to its Moto G line of budget phones, featuring the Moto G and Moto G Power. The standout model, the Moto G Power, comes with an IP69 water-resistance rating, making it tougher than most flagship phones at a price of just $299.99.

  • The Moto G Power is rated for both submersion in water and exposure to high-pressure water jets.
  • It’s passed the MIL-STD-810H certification for exposure to harsh environments.
  • Tested to survive falls from nearly four feet and temperatures from -4 to 140 degrees Fahrenheit.
  • The phone features a large 6.8-inch LCD display and a 5,000mAh battery.
  • It will be available online and through major carriers starting January 30th, 2025.
“There’s nothing wrong with a little peace of mind.” - Motorola

In conclusion, the 2025 Moto G Power offers standout durability at a competitive price, making it an appealing choice for users looking for a budget-friendly yet robust smartphone.
newTitle: Motorola's Tough New Phone Priced at Just $299.99

title: You don’t need a smartphone: a practical, personal guide to downgrading your device - The Guardian
summary:
You don’t need a smartphone: a practical, personal guide to downgrading your device

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article reflects on the author's journey of downgrading from a smartphone to a basic phone, detailing the life-changing benefits of reducing screen time, rediscovering idleness, and enhancing presence in daily life.

  • Years of smartphone use led to anxiety and distraction.
  • Switching to a basic phone changed the author’s perception of time and enhanced activities like reading and walking.
  • Addressed practical concerns about two-factor authentication and staying connected.
  • Encourages readers to remember the value of being present and enjoying time without distractions.
“With time, patience and clever workarounds, we can all find our way back to that.”

In conclusion, the article advocates for a simpler lifestyle by downgrading from smartphones, emphasizing the positive effects on mental health and creativity.
newTitle: You don’t need a smartphone: a practical, personal guide to downgrading your device

title: Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone - GSMArena.com
summary:
Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone

Publication Date: Today
Source: GSM Arena

Samsung has begun a trial run of a new phone trade-in program called the Galaxy Trade-In Program, allowing users to get value out of their old devices without needing to purchase a new phone.

  • The program is initially available in South Korea and France.
  • Eligible devices include Galaxy S23, S22, S21, S20 series, Z Fold5, Fold4, Fold3, Flip5, Flip4, and Flip3, although specific eligibility may vary by country.
  • The program is expected to expand to more markets later this year.
  • Phones will be graded into categories: Excellent, Good, or Recycle, with payouts based on the grade.
“We’re excited to launch our brand-new year-round Galaxy Trade-In Program in an effort to enrich the value of Galaxy devices for users and contribute to a circular economy...” - Jun Kim, Samsung Electronics

This program aims to create a circular economy by enriching the value of Galaxy devices and allowing users to trade-in their phones safely.
newTitle: Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone

title: Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
summary:
Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Samsung News

Samsung has initiated a trial of the Galaxy Trade-In Program, allowing customers to gain value from their old devices without needing to purchase a new phone. Currently operating in South Korea and France, this program accepts various Galaxy models for trade-in.

  • The program is designed to support a circular economy.
  • Eligible devices include Galaxy S20, S21, S22, S23 series, and Z Fold and Flip models.
  • Payments vary based on the condition of the devices categorized as Excellent, Good, or Recycle.
  • The program is expected to expand to more markets later this year.
“We’re excited to launch our brand-new year-round Galaxy Trade-In Program in an effort to enrich the value of Galaxy devices for users and contribute to a circular economy,” said Jun Kim, EVP and Head of Galaxy Value Innovation team, Mobile eXperience Business at Samsung Electronics.

This innovative program highlights Samsung's commitment to sustainability and customer value, setting a new benchmark in the phone trade-in landscape.
newTitle: Samsung launches new phone trade-in program where you don't have to buy a new phone

title: Ahead Of Galaxy S25 Series Launch, Samsung Launches New Galaxy Trade-In Programme - NDTV Profit
summary:

Date: 14 Jan 2025 Source: NDTV Profit Tech

Samsung has announced a new Galaxy Trade-In Programme that allows users to trade in eligible Galaxy devices for instant credit towards purchasing new devices on Samsung.com. The programme is set to pilot in Korea and France starting January 14, 2025, ahead of the anticipated launch of the Galaxy S25 series.

  • The trade-in programme allows instant credit at checkout for eligible devices.
  • Eligible devices include Galaxy S23, S22, S21, S20 series, Galaxy Z Fold5, and other Fold/Flip models.
  • The programme aims for broader availability across regions throughout 2025.
  • Instructions for participation and trade-in requirements have been outlined by Samsung.
“The new Samsung programme will pilot in Korea and France starting Jan. 14 and expand to more regions through 2025.”

This trade-in initiative is expected to enhance user engagement and encourage upgrades to the latest Galaxy devices.
